intro: Erigeron perramosus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its foliage is usually gray-green with hairy surfaces, and it produces small white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron perramosus is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
